block.p: Shannan Lee Maher, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Michael J. Maher of Morristown, N.J., was married on Martha's Vineyard yesterday to Dr. Jared Martin Sullivan, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Gregory F. Sullivan of Upper Montclair, N.J. Msgr. William C. Harms performed the ceremony at St. Elizabeth's Roman Catholic Church in Edgartown, Mass.

Mrs. Sullivan, 29, graduated from Georgetown University and earlier this month received an M.B.A. degree from the University of Maryland at College Park. Her father is the senior vice president of the credit department, in New York, at Unibank, which is headquartered in Copenhagen. Her mother, Mary Ann Maher, is a gerontological nurse at Sage, a nonprofit nursing service in Summit, N.J.

Shannan Lee Maher, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Michael J. Maher of Morristown, N.J., was married on Martha's Vineyard yesterday to Dr. Jared Martin Sullivan, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Gregory F. Sullivan of Upper Montclair, N.J. Msgr. William C. Harms performed the ceremony at St. Elizabeth's Roman Catholic Church in Edgartown, Mass.

Mrs. Sullivan, 29, graduated from Georgetown University and earlier this month received an M.B.A. degree from the University of Maryland at College Park. Her father is the senior vice president of the credit department, in New York, at Unibank, which is headquartered in Copenhagen. Her mother, Mary Ann Maher, is a gerontological nurse at Sage, a nonprofit nursing service in Summit, N.J.

Mr. Sullivan, 30, graduated from St. Mary's College in Moraga, Calif., and received a medical degree from Saba University, in the Netherlands Antilles. He is to become a resident in obstetrics and gynecology at St. Michael's Hospital in Newark in July. His mother, Gene Sullivan, is an owner of Ivory Bird Antiques in Montclair, N.J. His father is an interventional cardiologist in Clifton, N.J.
